AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.marijuana: substance for distribution, weighing between 100 and 1,000 kilograms
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.large white Ford pickup truck: vehicle involved in the stop by United States/Mexican Border Patrol, suspected of being a lead car, with equipment including tool boxes, a spare gas tank, and an air tank in its bed, bearing a Kansas license plate, exhibited unusual driving behavior near Marathon, Texas, and was stopped 70 or 80 miles from the United States/Mexican Border, containing two unloaded handguns, subject of a motion to suppress evidence, driven by Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot, traveled through an area very close to the United States/Mexican Border prior to the stop, with proximity to the border being a factor in the stop, and was seen leaving Big Bend National Park early on a Sunday morning, deviating from typical traffic patterns
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.alien smuggling cases: cases involving the smuggling of aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.narcotics cases: cases involving narcotics, including a recent operation in the Alpine, Texas area destined for locations in Kansas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.contraband: suspected cargo in the load car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.late model four-door sedan: vehicle observed by United States/Mexican Border Patrol, carrying an older Anglo couple and bearing a Big Bend National Park registration receipt and a Mississippi license plate
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.two unloaded handguns: dangerous weapons found in the large white Ford pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. District Court: court that determined the large white Ford pickup truck was traveling through an area very close to the United States/Mexican Border prior to the stop, and accepted factual findings relevant to the stop, including the reputation of Texas Highway 385 as a smuggling route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican Border Patrol: agency that stopped the large white Ford pickup truck and observed the late model four-door sedan, with proximity to the border being a factor in the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot: driver of the large white Ford pickup truck, who asserts that the proximity-to-the-United States/Mexican Border Patrol factor should weigh against a finding of reasonable suspicion, and notes that Texas Highway 385 is also a major highway used by thousands of visitors to Big Bend National Park
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican Border: border near which the large white Ford pickup truck was stopped, with the vehicle having traveled through an area very close to the border prior to the stop
